required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Avenanthramides Supplement on Exercise-induced Physiological and Psychological Changes

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the proposed study is to examine whether long-term dietary supplementation (8 weeks) of an oat flour cookie rich in avenanthramides (AVA) could enhance blood antioxidant capacity and reduce blood inflammatory markers after a downhill running (DR) protocol among human subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean and SD of plasma concentrations of Creatine Kinase

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean and SD of plasma concentrations of TNF-α
Mean and SD of plasma concentrations of IL-6
Mean and SD of plasma concentrations of ICAM-1, VCAM-1, NF-κB (P65), NRB, NF-κB binding to DNA, 4-Hydroxynenenol, F2-isoprostane

intervention.description: AVAs are a group of diphenolic acids that are found only in oats (Avena sativa).

overall_official.affiliation: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute
